document.docAuthor: Lee, Chi-Feng, Bezdĕk, Jan & Staines, Charles L.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Agetocera (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) in Taiwan — are there only two species?

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the genus Agetocera (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) in Taiwan — are there only two species?

bibRefCitation.author: Weise
bibRefCitation.refString: Weise, J. (1922) Chrysomeliden der Indo-Malayischen region. Tijdschrift voor Entomologie, 65, 39 - 130.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Length 12.7–14.9 mm , width 6.1–7.5 mm (n= 12 ). General color (Figs 1–4 ) yellowish brown; antennomeres IX–XI black; apical half of tibia and tarsi darkened, two apical tarsomeres dark brown; elytra dark bluish-metallic. Pronotum transverse, about 0.6–0.7 times as long as wide. Elytra wide, about 1.4–1.5 times as long as wide, widest at apical 1 / 3 .

Female. Antenna (Fig. 10 ) filiform, relative length of antennomeres II–XI about 1.0: 1.5 : 1.7 : 1.7 : 1.7 : 1.7 : 2.4 : 2.2 : 2.6 : 4.4 . Apical margin of abdominal ventrite V (Fig. 19 ) truncate, slightly bisinuate at middle. Abdominal tergite VIII (Fig. 23 ) composed of two separated, well sclerotized sclerites, transverse and widest at middle; hairs appearing at anterior half, denser near anterior and mesal margins. Receptacle of spermatheca (Fig. 24 ) shorter, and wider than pump; pump long and strongly curved. Gonocoxae (Fig. 25 ) very close, short and cylindrical, apex with dense setae, one of them being extremely long. Bursa-sclerites composed of several small circular sclerites and one longitudinal and irregularly margined sclerite (Fig. 26 ).
Diagnosis. This species is easily distinguished from other Taiwanese members of the genus by its larger body and wider elytra, and the structure of male and female genitalia.

Type material.
Not examined.
Agetocera discedens
was described based on unspecified number of females. No type specimen was found in Museum für Naturkunde der Humboldt–Universität Berlin ( Germany ) where the Weise´s collection is deposited.

Specimens examined (
291 specimens
).

Distribution. Taiwan (Fig. 35 ). This is the most common and widespread species of
Agetocera
in Taiwan based on literature, specimens examined, and field experience of the senior author.

Host plants. Cucurbitaceae :
Gynostemma pentaphyllum (Thunb.) Makino
,
Thladiantha nudiflora Hemsl.ex Forbes & Hemsl.
,
Trichosanthes cucumeroides (Ser.) Maxim. ex Fr. & Sav.
and
T. laceribracteata Hayata.
Adults also visit flowers of
Hydrangea angustipetala Hayata
( Saxifragaceae ).
